title: (x) Encyclopedia of Hell - Democratica, Cochin {Dav, Yves}
content:
After looking around for books and reading the samples on Amazon, I came across a book — Encyclopedia of Hell — that used interesting fonts for the italics and names of the demons. They were too small for WhatTheFont to recognize, so I figured I’d try here. I apologize for the small and dull samples — but that’s all I had. Any ideas on what the fonts are?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fontsamples.gif](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=fontsamples.gif) | 11.27 KB |
author: tartarus

comments.content: Oops, didn’t see this one wasn’t completely IDed. [Cochin Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110030219/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=LH.166.0.2) for the italics (obviously).
Ooh, Sorry, I totally forgot about this one..
Hmm, are the “powers that be” working on letting us see the samples immediately? Or will this currently way of displaying the samples staying?
